parsact.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 /*****************************************************************************
00002 
00003   Description:  This file contains action routines for the Object
00004                 Description Language parser.  The routines are
00005                 called by the parser when specific production
00006                 rules are triggered.
00007 
00008   Author:  Randy Davis, University of Colorado LASP
00009 
00010   Creation Date:  20 March 1989
00011   Last Modified:  18 May 1991
00012 
00013   History:
00014 
00015     Creation - This set of routines was introduced in Version 1 of
00016     the ODLC library.
00017 
00018     Version 2.0 - 26 November 1990 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00019       a) Upgraded routines to be compatible with Version 2 of ODL.  Some
00020          of the routine names and calling sequences have changes as a
00021          result of this upgrade.
00022       b) Converted to use new warning and error reporting scheme.
00023       c) Created routine ODLCheckSequence to perform checks on
00024          sequences previously performed as part of ODLMarkAttribute.
00025       d) Defined global variables in this module rather than in ReadLabel.
00026 
00027     Version 2.1 - 13 March 1991 - R. Davis, U. of Colorado LASP
00028       a) Modified the calling sequence to these routines so that only
00029          pointers to value data structures are passed as arguments,
00030          rather than having the entire structure copied in.
00031       b) Added a new global variable ODLcurrent_comment to hold a pointer to
00032          the most recently encountered comment.  Also added code to 
00033          ODLBeginAggregate and ODLBeginParameter to attach the current
00034          comment, if any, to the new aggregate or parameter node.
00035       c) Moved the definition of global variables ODLerror_count and
00036          ODLwarning_count out of this module.
00037 
00038   Version 2.2 - 18 May 1991 - M. DeMore, Jet Propulsion Laboratory
00039     a) Removed include statements that were Unix specific and placed them
00040        in odldef.h. Removed function prototypes that are now in an
00041        include file and added include file odlinter.h.
00042     b) Added PDS_TOOLBOX options to store a line number in each parameter
00043        and aggregate structure.
00044 
00045 *****************************************************************************/
00046 
00047 #include <stdlib.h>
00048 #include "odldef.h"
00049 #include "odlinter.h"
00050 
00051 /* The following variables are defined in this module and referenced
00052    in other modules.  Note that their presence makes ODL parsing
00053    non-re-entrant */
00054 
00055 AGGREGATE   ODLroot_node;              /* Pointer to root node of ODL tree  */
00056 AGGREGATE   ODLcurrent_aggregate;      /* Pointer to current aggregate node */
00057 PARAMETER   ODLcurrent_parameter;      /* Pointer to current parameter node */
00058 VALUE       ODLcurrent_value;          /* Pointer to current value node     */
00059 char       *ODLcurrent_comment;        /* Pointer to current comment        */
00060 
00061 /* The following variables are defined in the module containing the output
00062    routines ODLPrintError and ODLPrintWarning */
00063 
00064 extern int  ODLerror_count;            /* Cumulative count of errors        */
00065 extern int  ODLwarning_count;          /* Cumulative count of warnings      */
00066 
00067 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BEGIN CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00068 /* >>>>> MDD 5/14/91  Added external definition of yylineno so     >>>>> */
00069 /* >>>>>              line numbers could be placed in aggregates   >>>>> */
00070 /* >>>>>              and parameters.                              >>>>> */
00071 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00072 
00073 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00074 
00075 extern int yylineno;
00076 
00077 #endif
00078 
00079 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> END OF CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00080 
00081 
00082 /*****************************************************************************
00083 
00084   Routine: ODLBeginAggregate
00085 
00086   Description:  Creates a new aggregate node on the ODL tree in response to
00087                 the processing of an OBJECT = name or GROUP = name line.
00088 
00089   Input:   kind - Aggregate kind: object (KA_OBJECT) or group (KA_GROUP).
00090            item - Pointer to a value data structure containing a string
00091                   with the name of the new object or group.
00092           
00093   Output:  None.  A new aggregate node is attached to the ODL tree.
00094            
00095 *****************************************************************************/
00096 
00097 
00098 void ODLBeginAggregate (
00099      
00100      AGGREGATE_KIND    kind,
00101      VALUE_DATA       *item)
00102 
00103 {
00104 
00105   /* Create a new aggregate node */
00106 
00107   ODLcurrent_aggregate = NewAggregate (ODLcurrent_aggregate, kind,
00108                                        item->value.string, "");
00109 
00110   /* Free up the memory space used to hold the aggregate name */
00111 
00112   free (item->value.string);
00113 
00114   /* Attach the current comment, if any, to the new aggregate  */
00115 
00116   ODLcurrent_aggregate->comment = ODLcurrent_comment;
00117   ODLcurrent_comment = NULL;
00118 
00119 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BEGIN CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00120 /* >>>>> MDD 5/14/91  Added code to set the appl1 field in the     >>>>> */
00121 /* >>>>>              aggregate to the current line number         >>>>> */
00122 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00123 
00124 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00125 
00126   ODLcurrent_aggregate -> appl1 = yylineno;
00127 
00128 #endif
00129 
00130 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> END OF CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00131 
00132   return;
00133 }
00134

00136 
00137 
00138 /*****************************************************************************
00139 
00140   Routine: ODLEndAggregate
00141  
00142   Description:  Closes out processing for the current aggregate node
00143                 and reverts to its parent.
00144  
00145   Input:   kind - Aggregate kind: indicates whether an END_OBJECT or
00146                   END_GROUP statement was seen by the parser.
00147            item - Pointer to a value data structure containing a string
00148                   with the object/group name found in the END_OBJECT or
00149                   END_GROUP (if any).
00150            
00151   Output:  None.
00152            
00153 *****************************************************************************/
00154 
00155 
00156 void ODLEndAggregate (
00157 
00158      AGGREGATE_KIND   kind,
00159      VALUE_DATA      *item)
00160 
00161 {
00162   char  errmsg[120];                      /* Error message text          */
00163 
00164 
00165   if (ODLcurrent_aggregate != ODLroot_node)
00166     {
00167       if (ODLcurrent_aggregate->kind == kind)
00168         {
00169           /* Make sure that the name in the END_OBJECT or END_GROUP part
00170              matches the name that was given previously in the OBJECT
00171              or GROUP part */
00172 
00173           if (item->value.string != NULL)
00174             {
00175               if (strcmp (item->value.string, ODLcurrent_aggregate->name) != 0)
00176                 {
00177                   sprintf (errmsg,
00178                            "END_%s = %s doesn't match %s = %s",
00179                            (kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "OBJECT" : "GROUP",
00180                            item->value.string,
00181                            (kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "OBJECT" : "GROUP",
00182                            ODLcurrent_aggregate->name);
00183                   ODLPrintWarning (errmsg);
00184                 }
00185 
00186               /* Free up the memory space used to hold the name */
00187 
00188               free (item->value.string);
00189             }
00190 
00191           /* Revert to the parent object or group */
00192 
00193           ODLcurrent_aggregate = ParentAggregate (ODLcurrent_aggregate);
00194         }
00195       else
00196         {
00197           /* Found an END_GROUP when expecting END_OBJECT, or vice versa */
00198 
00199           sprintf (errmsg,
00200                "Found END_%s when expecting END_%s - Ignored",
00201                (kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "OBJECT" : "GROUP",
00202                (ODLcurrent_aggregate->kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "OBJECT" : "GROUP");
00203           ODLPrintError (errmsg);
00204         }
00205     }
00206   else
00207     {
00208       /* Found an extra END_GROUP or END_OBJECT */
00209 
00210       sprintf (errmsg,
00211                "Encountered an extra END_%s - Ignored",
00212                (kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "OBJECT" : "GROUP");
00213       ODLPrintError (errmsg);
00214     }
00215 
00216   /* Get rid of any 'dangling' comment, since we don't have any parameter
00217      to attach it to */
00218 
00219   if (ODLcurrent_comment != NULL)
00220     {
00221       free (ODLcurrent_comment);
00222       ODLcurrent_comment = NULL;
00223     }
00224 
00225   return;
00226 }

00230 
00231 /*****************************************************************************
00232 
00233   Routine: ODLBeginParameter
00234  
00235   Description:  Creates a new parameter node for the current object or group.
00236  
00237   Input:   kind - Parameter kind: attribute (KP_ATTRIBUTE) or
00238                   pointer (KP_POINTER).
00239            item - Pointer to a value data structure containing a string
00240                   with the name of the new parameter.
00241            
00242   Output:  None.  A new parameter node is attached to the current object
00243                   or group node.
00244            
00245 *****************************************************************************/
00246 
00247 
00248 void ODLBeginParameter (
00249 
00250      PARAMETER_KIND   kind,
00251      VALUE_DATA      *item)
00252 
00253 {
00254   char  warning[120];                      /* Warning message text          */
00255 
00256 
00257   /* Look to see if a parameter with this name already exists for the
00258      current object or group */
00259 
00260   if (FindParameter (ODLcurrent_aggregate, item->value.string) != NULL)
00261     {
00262       /* It does: issue a warning */
00263 
00264       sprintf (warning,
00265                "A parameter named %s already exists for %s %s.",
00266                item->value.string,
00267                (ODLcurrent_aggregate->kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "object" : "group",
00268                ODLcurrent_aggregate->name);
00269       ODLPrintWarning (warning);
00270     }
00271 
00272   /* Create the new parameter node */
00273 
00274   ODLcurrent_parameter = NewParameter (ODLcurrent_aggregate, kind,
00275                                        item->value.string);
00276 
00277   /* Free up the memory space used to hold the parameter name */
00278 
00279   free (item->value.string);
00280 
00281   /* Attach the current comment, if any, to the new parameter  */
00282 
00283   ODLcurrent_parameter->comment = ODLcurrent_comment;
00284   ODLcurrent_comment = NULL;
00285 
00286 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> BEGIN CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00287 /* >>>>> MDD 5/14/91  Added code to set the appl1 field in the     >>>>> */
00288 /* >>>>>              parameter to the current line number         >>>>> */
00289 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00290 
00291 #ifdef PDS_TOOLBOX
00292 
00293   ODLcurrent_parameter -> appl1 = yylineno;
00294 
00295 #endif
00296 
00297 /* >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> END OF CN CHANGES >>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> */
00298 
00299   return;
00300 }

00316            
00317 *****************************************************************************/
00318 
00319 
00320 void ODLMarkParameter (
00321 
00322      VALUE_KIND    kind)
00323 
00324 {
00325 
00326   /* Save the parameter value kind */
00327 
00328   ODLcurrent_parameter->value_kind = kind; 
00329 
00330   return;
00331 }

00348 
00349 
00350 void ODLStoreValue (
00351 
00352      VALUE_DATA    *item)
00353 
00354 {
00355 
00356   /* Attach the new value node to the current parameter */
00357 
00358   ODLcurrent_value = NewValue (ODLcurrent_parameter, item);
00359 
00360   return;
00361 }

00365     
00366 /*****************************************************************************
00367 
00368   Routine: ODLStoreUnits1
00369  
00370   Description:  Store a units value without an exponent.
00371  
00372   Input:
00373            name     - Pointer to a value data structure with a string
00374                       specifying the units name.
00375 
00376   Output:  None.  A units field descriptor structure is created.
00377            
00378 *****************************************************************************/
00379 
00380 
00381 void ODLStoreUnits1 (
00382 
00383      VALUE_DATA     *name)
00384 
00385 {
00386   VALUE_DATA    exponent;   /* A value data structure for default exponent  */
00387 
00388   /* Since no exponent was specified we will set it to the default value +1 */
00389 
00390   exponent.type = TV_INTEGER;
00391   exponent.value.integer.number = 1;
00392 
00393   /* Now we can call our sister routine to create and store the new units
00394      field descriptor */
00395 
00396   ODLStoreUnits2 (name, &exponent);
00397 
00398   return;
00399 }
00400 
00401 
00402 
00403 
00404 /*****************************************************************************
00405 
00406   Routine: ODLStoreUnits2
00407  
00408   Description:  Store a units value with an exponent.
00409  
00410   Input:
00411            name     - Pointer to a value data structure containing a
00412                       string with the units name.
00413            exponent - Pointer to a value data structure containing the
00414                       integer exponent value.
00415 
00416   Output:  None.  A units field descriptor structure is created.
00417            
00418 *****************************************************************************/
00419 
00420 
00421 void ODLStoreUnits2 (
00422 
00423      VALUE_DATA    *name,
00424      VALUE_DATA    *exponent)
00425 
00426 {
00427   struct ODLUnits *new_units;      /* Pointer to new units field descriptor */
00428   struct ODLUnits *current_units;  /* Pointer to current field descriptor   */
00429 
00430 
00431   /* Allocate memory in which to store the units field descriptor */
00432 
00433   new_units = (struct ODLUnits *) malloc (sizeof(struct ODLUnits));
00434   if (new_units == NULL)
00435     {
00436       ODLPrintWarning ("Memory allocation failure while storing units");
00437     }
00438   else
00439     {
00440       /* Copy the pointer to the units designator */
00441  
00442       new_units->designator = name->value.string;
00443 
00444       /* Set the units exponent */
00445 
00446       new_units->exponent = exponent->value.integer.number;
00447 
00448       /* Indicate that this is the last units field descriptor in the chain */
00449 
00450       new_units->next_field = NULL;
00451 
00452       /* Store the units field descriptor */
00453 
00454       switch (ODLcurrent_value->item.type)
00455        {
00456         case TV_REAL:
00457 
00458           current_units = ODLcurrent_value->item.value.real.units;
00459           if (current_units != NULL)
00460             {
00461               break;
00462             }
00463    
00464           /* This is the first units field for a real value */
00465 
00466           ODLcurrent_value->item.value.real.units = new_units;
00467           return;
00468    
00469         case TV_INTEGER:
00470 
00471           current_units = ODLcurrent_value->item.value.integer.units;
00472           if (current_units != NULL)
00473             {
00474               break;
00475             }
00476 
00477           /* This is the first units field for an integer value */
00478 
00479           ODLcurrent_value->item.value.integer.units = new_units;
00480           return;
00481 
00482         default:
00483           /* This should never happen */
00484 
00485           free (new_units->designator);
00486           free (new_units);
00487           return;
00488        }
00489 
00490       /* There is already at least one units field: find the end of the
00491          chain and tack this units field onto the end */
00492  
00493       while (current_units->next_field != NULL)
00494         {
00495           current_units = current_units->next_field;
00496         }
00497 
00498       current_units->next_field = new_units;
00499     }
00500 
00501   return;
00502 }
00503 
00504     
00505 
00506     
00507 /*****************************************************************************
00508 
00509   Routine: ODLMarkUnits
00510  
00511   Description:  Modifies the sign of the exponent for the most recently
00512                 recorded units field to indicate whether the units field
00513                 is a multiplier or a divisor relative to the previous
00514                 units expression.  For example, if a units expression of
00515                 <KM/SEC> is encountered, this routine will be called with
00516                 a value of -1 to indicate that the exponent associated
00517                 with the units field for seconds must be negated.  The
00518                 expression will then be stored internally as KM^1, SEC^-1.
00519  
00520   Input:
00521            exponent_sign - Set to +1 if the units field is a multiplier (for
00522                            which the units exponent is given a positive value)
00523                            or -1 if the units field is to be a divisor (for
00524                            which the units exponent needs to be negative).
00525 
00526   Output:  None.  The last units field descriptor structure may be modified.
00527            
00528 *****************************************************************************/
00529 
00530 
00531 void ODLMarkUnits (
00532 
00533      int     exponent_sign)
00534 
00535 {
00536   struct ODLUnits *current_units;  /* Pointer to current field descriptor   */
00537 
00538 
00539   /* If the units field is acting as a multiplier then the exponent sign
00540      is already set properly and we don't have to do anything.  Otherwise,
00541      we need to negate the sign of the last units field exponent. */
00542 
00543   if (exponent_sign < 0)
00544     {
00545       /* We need to negate the exponent sign: find the last
00546          units field descriptor */
00547 
00548       if (ODLcurrent_value->item.type == TV_REAL)
00549         {
00550           current_units = ODLcurrent_value->item.value.real.units;
00551         }
00552       else if (ODLcurrent_value->item.type == TV_INTEGER)
00553         {
00554           current_units = ODLcurrent_value->item.value.integer.units;
00555         }
00556       else
00557         {
00558           current_units = NULL;
00559         }
00560 
00561       if (current_units != NULL)
00562         {
00563           while (current_units->next_field != NULL)
00564             {
00565               current_units = current_units->next_field;
00566             }
00567 
00568           /* Negate the exponent */
00569 
00570           current_units->exponent = -current_units->exponent;
00571         }
00572     }
00573   
00574   return;
00575 }

00578 
00579 
00580 /*****************************************************************************
00581 
00582   Routine: ODLCheckSequence
00583  
00584   Description:  Keeps track of number of rows and columns in a sequence.
00585  
00586   Input:   None.
00587            
00588   Output:  Warning message printed if problem detected.
00589            
00590 *****************************************************************************/
00591 
00592 
00593 void ODLCheckSequence ()
00594 {
00595   char  warning[120];           /* Character string to hold warning message */
00596 
00597 
00598   /* Increment the count of rows.  If this is the first row, establish the
00599      number of columns per row.  All further rows should have the same
00600      number of columns. */
00601 
00602   ODLcurrent_parameter->rows++;
00603   if (ODLcurrent_parameter->rows == 1)
00604     {
00605       ODLcurrent_parameter->columns = ODLcurrent_parameter->value_count;
00606     }
00607   else if (ODLcurrent_parameter->rows*ODLcurrent_parameter->columns !=
00608            ODLcurrent_parameter->value_count)
00609     { 
00610       sprintf (warning,
00611           "Row %d of sequence has different number of columns than first row",
00612           ODLcurrent_parameter->rows);
00613       ODLPrintWarning (warning);
00614     }
00615 
00616   return;
00617 }
00618 
00619 
00620 
00621 
00622 /*****************************************************************************
00623 
00624   Routine: ODLCheckRange
00625  
00626   Description:  Checks the low and high range values.
00627  
00628   Input:
00629            low  - Value data structure containing the low value of the range.
00630            high - Value data structure containing the high value of the range.
00631 
00632   Output:  Warning message printed if a problem is detected.
00633            
00634 *****************************************************************************/
00635 
00636 
00637 void ODLCheckRange (
00638 
00639      VALUE_DATA    *low,
00640      VALUE_DATA    *high)
00641 
00642 {
00643 
00644   /* Check the high and low range values */
00645 
00646   if (high->value.integer.number < low->value.integer.number)
00647     {
00648       ODLPrintWarning ("Low value of range is greater than high value");
00649     }
00650 
00651   /* Since there is no special range value kind in ODL Version 2, establish
00652      that the range value will be represented as a sequence. */
00653 
00654   ODLCheckSequence ();
00655 
00656   return;
00657 }
00658 
00659 
00660 
00661 
00662 /*****************************************************************************
00663 
00664   Routine: ODLEndLabel
00665  
00666   Description:  Finishes processing when the end of a label is found.
00667  
00668   Input:   None.
00669            
00670   Output:  The function value is set to 1 if no errors occurred during
00671            parsing; otherwise the value is set to 0.
00672            
00673 *****************************************************************************/
00674 
00675 
00676 int ODLEndLabel ()
00677 {
00678   char  error_msg[120];                 /* Error message text               */
00679 
00680 
00681   while (ODLcurrent_aggregate != ODLroot_node)
00682     {
00683       /* Put out an error message for each missing END_OBJECT or END_GROUP  */
00684 
00685       sprintf (error_msg,
00686                "Missing END_%s for %s %s.",
00687                (ODLcurrent_aggregate->kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "OBJECT" : "GROUP",
00688                (ODLcurrent_aggregate->kind==KA_OBJECT) ? "object" : "group",
00689                ODLcurrent_aggregate->name);
00690       ODLPrintError(error_msg);
00691 
00692       /* Point to the current aggregate node's parent */
00693     
00694       ODLcurrent_aggregate = ParentAggregate (ODLcurrent_aggregate);
00695     }
00696 
00697   return ((ODLerror_count+ODLwarning_count) == 0);
00698 }
